title.narrative: Developing Guidelines On School Safety And Resilient School Building Codes, Mozambique (Cross Ref: C218; World Bank Funding

description.narrative:
Favorably, the attention of National Authorities in Mozambique is clearly shifting to an integrated DRR approach, which addresses underlying risk factors as much as strengthen preparedness and response. Therefore, National Institutions (Ministry of Education, Ministry of Public Works and Housing, National Institute for Disaster Management/ Ministry of State Administration are increasingly aware of the need either to build safer schools or to building back better, in the event of disaster.The latest events seem to have accelerated this process and arisen interest for changing the underlying causes of vulnerability.
The Government has moved from a reactive to a a Preventive approach to managing disasters with the adoption of Disaster Management Policy in 1999, the establishment of National Institute of Disaster Management (INGC) within the Minister of State Administration (MAE) and the adoption of national master plan for prevention and mitigation of Natural Calamities in 2006. This represents an enabling context for insisting on sustainable strategies that reduce risks of disasters over the long-term and strengthen resilience of communities.
Considering the above, the UN-Habitat and UEM/FAPF consider the scope and reach of these project as highly relevant and the action timely initiated. UNHABITAT and UEM/FAPF propose a series of Strategic Components and Working Packages under the guidance and leadership of INGC and with the MINED as main clients and MOPH as crucial partner.All technical assistance offered is submitted to this leadership and guidance.
